Model.Fields

Class PropertyField

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Fields.Field
      • Model.Fields.PropertyField

  • public class PropertyField
extends Field
    This class manages fields that are ownable and able to be built on (houses and hotels) These fields can be bought by a player.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PropertyField(String name, String subText, String description, int[] prices, Color color)
      PropertyFields should be instantiated with a price array of length 10.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropertyField

        public PropertyField(String name,
                     String subText,
                     String description,
                     int[] prices,
                     Color color)
        PropertyFields should be instantiated with a price array of length 10. These array elemented are expected to be {Price to buy, rent, rent with 1 house, 2 houses, 3 houses, 4 houses, a hotel, house price, hotel prisce, price from pawning} the pawn price is not used in any logic yet. The field should have a color too. This is used for some game logic, and for visual purposes
        Parameters:
        name -
        subText -
        description -
        prices - {Price to buy, rent, rent with 1 house, 2 houses, 3 houses, 4 houses, a hotel, house price, hotel prisce, price from pawning}
        color -

      • fieldAction

        public void fieldAction(Player player)
        When a player lands on an owned field, they will pay rent to the owner. If not another part of the game can take care of letting it be bought In both cases, the main player log is written to
        Overrides:
        fieldAction in class Field
        Parameters:
        player - that has landed on the field

      • buyField

        public void buyField(Player player)
        Method to buy a PropertyField from given price array. Also write to log.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who will buy the property

      • buyHouse

        public void buyHouse()
        Expand property with houses. A player can have a maximum of 4 houses. Player cannot buy houses on a property if they can't afford it.

      • buyHotel

        public void buyHotel()
        Expand property with a hotel. A player can have a maximum of 1 hotel AFTER BUYING 4 HOUSES. Player cannot buy a hotel on a property if they can't afford it.

      • sellHouse

        public void sellHouse()
        Sell house if any are owned. Only get back half of the buying price.

      • sellHotel

        public void sellHotel()
        Sell hotel if one is owned. Only get back half of the buying price.

      • calcRentIndex

        public void calcRentIndex()
        Calculate rent from the currentRentIndex. This index is incremented every time a house or hotel is bought.
